translator.minionExpressionTranslator
Class AtomExpressionTranslator

java.lang.Object
  translator.minionExpressionTranslator.AtomExpressionTranslator
All Implemented Interfaces:
MinionTranslatorGlobals
Direct Known Subclasses:
MulopExpressionTranslator
public class AtomExpressionTranslator
extends Object
implements MinionTranslatorGlobals

Translates simple expressions, which are AtomicExpressions (booleans, numbers, identifiers) or NonAtomicExpressions (vector- or matrixelements). All expressions have to be fully evaluated before the translation process.

Author:
andrea
See Also:
AtomicExpression, NonAtomicExpression

translateAtomExpression

protected MinionIdentifier translateAtomExpression(Expression e)
                                            throws TranslationUnsupportedException,
                                                   MinionException,
                                                   PreprocessorException
Translates Expression e to a MinionIdentifier. The Expression HAS to be either atomic (number, boolean, identifier) or a matrix-element.

Parameters:
e - the atom Expression that will be translated
Returns:
the MinionIdentifier representing e
Throws:
TranslationUnsupportedException
MinionException
PreprocessorException

translateSingleAtomExpression

protected void translateSingleAtomExpression(Expression e)
                                      throws TranslationUnsupportedException,
                                             MinionException,
                                             PreprocessorException
Translates an expression, that is an atom and a stand-alon constraint. This expression can either be an identifier (variable or matrix-element), number or boolean value. If the expression is false, a warning is printed. If the expression is 'true', it is ignored. Variables and numbers are set to equal one, meaning that they are true.

Parameters:
e - an atom Expression, either of subtype AtomicExpression or NonAtomicExpression
Throws:
TranslationUnsupportedException
MinionException
PreprocessorException

print_debug

protected static void print_debug(String s)
If the DEBUG-flag in the Globals-interface is set to true, then print the debug-messages. These messages are rather interesting for the developper than for the user.

Parameters:
s - : the String to be printed on the output
